post.description:
Transfers a positions from one subaccount to another, owned by the same wallet.

The transfer is executed as a pair of orders crossing each other.
The maker order is created first, followed by a taker order crossing it.
The order amounts, limit prices and instrument name must be the same for both orders.
Fee is not charged and a zero `max_fee` must be signed.
The maker order is forcibly considered to be `reduce_only`, meaning it can only reduce the position size.

History: For position transfer history, use the `private/get_trade_history` RPC (not `private/get_erc20_transfer_history`).

Limit price in quote currency.

max_fee.title: max_fee
max_fee.description: Max fee in units of the quote currency. Order will be rejected if the supplied max fee is below the estimated fee for this order.

mmp.description: Whether the order is tagged for market maker protections (default false)

nonce.description: Unique nonce defined as <UTC_timestamp in ms><random_number_up_to_6_digits> (e.g. 1695836058725001, where 001 is the random number)

order_type.title: order_type
order_type.description:
Order type:
- `limit`: limit order (default)
- `market`: market order, note that limit_price is still required for market orders, but unfilled order portion will be marked as cancelled

reduce_only.title: reduce_only
reduce_only.description: If true, the order will not be able to increase position's size (default false). If the order amount exceeds available position size, the order will be filled up to the position size and the remainder will be cancelled. This flag is only supported for market orders or non-resting limit orders (IOC or FOK)

referral_code.title: referral_code
referral_code.description: Optional referral code for the order

reject_timestamp.title: reject_timestamp
reject_timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in ms, if provided the matching engine will reject the order with an error if `reject_timestamp` < `server_time`. Note that the timestamp must be consistent with the server time: use `public/get_time` method to obtain current server time.

signature_expiry_sec.title: signature_expiry_sec
signature_expiry_sec.description: Unix timestamp in seconds. Order signature becomes invalid after this time, and the system will cancel the order.Expiry MUST be at least 5 min from now.

signer.title: signer
signer.description: Owner wallet address or registered session key that signed order

time_in_force.title: time_in_force
time_in_force.description:
Time in force behaviour:
- `gtc`: good til cancelled (default)
- `post_only`: a limit order that will be rejected if it crosses any order in the book, i.e. acts as a taker order
- `fok`: fill or kill, will be rejected if it is not fully filled
- `ioc`: immediate or cancel, fill at best bid/ask (market) or at limit price (limit), the unfilled portion is cancelled
Note that the order will still expire on the `signature_expiry_sec` timestamp.

mark_value.title: mark_value
mark_value.description: USD value of the position; this represents how much USD can be recieved by fully closing the position at the current oracle price

net_settlements.title: net_settlements
net_settlements.description:
Net amount of USD from position settlements that has been paid to the user's subaccount. This number is subtracted from the portfolio value for margin calculations purposes.
Positive values mean the user has recieved USD from settlements, or is awaiting settlement of USD losses. Negative values mean the user has paid USD for settlements, or is awaiting settlement of USD gains.

open_orders_margin.title: open_orders_margin
open_orders_margin.description: USD margin requirement for all open orders for this asset / instrument

pending_funding.title: pending_funding
pending_funding.description: A portion of funding payments that has not yet been settled into cash balance (only for perpetuals). This number is added to the portfolio value for margin calculations purposes.

realized_pnl.title: realized_pnl
realized_pnl.description: Realized trading profit or loss of the position.

unrealized_pnl.title: unrealized_pnl
unrealized_pnl.description: Unrealized trading profit or loss of the position.

post.description: Get the current mmp config for a subaccount (optionally filtered by currency)

mmp_amount_limit.title: mmp_amount_limit
mmp_amount_limit.description:
Maximum total order amount that can be traded within the mmp_interval across all instruments of the provided currency. The amounts are not netted, so a filled bid of 1 and a filled ask of 2 would count as 3.
Default: 0 (no limit)

mmp_delta_limit.title: mmp_delta_limit
mmp_delta_limit.description:
Maximum total delta that can be traded within the mmp_interval across all instruments of the provided currency. This quantity is netted, so a filled order with +1 delta and a filled order with -2 delta would count as -1
Default: 0 (no limit)

mmp_frozen_time.title: mmp_frozen_time
mmp_frozen_time.description: Time interval in ms setting how long the subaccount is frozen after an mmp trigger, if 0 then a manual reset would be required via private/reset_mmp

mmp_interval.title: mmp_interval
mmp_interval.description: Time interval in ms over which the limits are monotored, if 0 then mmp is disabled

subaccount_id.title: subaccount_id
subaccount_id.description: Subaccount_id for which to set the config

currency.title: currency
currency.description: Currency to get the config for. If not provided, returns all configs for the subaccount

subaccount_id.title: subaccount_id
subaccount_id.description: Subaccount_id for which to get the config

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Order amount in units of the base

limit_price.title: limit_price
limit_price.description:
Limit price in quote currency.
This field is still required for market orders because it is a component of the signature. However, market orders will not leave a resting order in the book in case of a partial fill.

max_fee.title: max_fee
max_fee.description: Max fee in units of the quote currency. Order will be rejected if the supplied max fee is below the estimated fee for this order.

nonce.title: nonce
nonce.description: Unique nonce defined as <UTC_timestamp in ms><random_number_up_to_6_digits> (e.g. 1695836058725001, where 001 is the random number)

signature_expiry_sec.title: signature_expiry_sec
signature_expiry_sec.description: Unix timestamp in seconds. Order signature becomes invalid after this time, and the system will cancel the order.Expiry MUST be at least 5 min from now.

signer.title: signer
signer.description: Owner wallet address or registered session key that signed order

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Order amount in units of the base

label.title: label
label.description: Optional user-defined label for the order

limit_price.title: limit_price
limit_price.description:
Limit price in quote currency.
This field is still required for market orders because it is a component of the signature. However, market orders will not leave a resting order in the book in case of a partial fill.

max_fee.title: max_fee
max_fee.description: Max fee in units of the quote currency. Order will be rejected if the supplied max fee is below the estimated fee for this order.

mmp.title: mmp
mmp.description: Whether the order is tagged for market maker protections (default false)

nonce.title: nonce
nonce.description: Unique nonce defined as <UTC_timestamp in ms><random_number_up_to_6_digits> (e.g. 1695836058725001, where 001 is the random number)

order_type.title: order_type
order_type.description:
Order type:
- `limit`: limit order (default)
- `market`: market order, note that limit_price is still required for market orders, but unfilled order portion will be marked as cancelled

reduce_only.title: reduce_only
reduce_only.description: If true, the order will not be able to increase position's size (default false). If the order amount exceeds available position size, the order will be filled up to the position size and the remainder will be cancelled. This flag is only supported for market orders or non-resting limit orders (IOC or FOK)

referral_code.title: referral_code
referral_code.description: Optional referral code for the order

reject_timestamp.title: reject_timestamp
reject_timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in ms, if provided the matching engine will reject the order with an error if `reject_timestamp` < `server_time`. Note that the timestamp must be consistent with the server time: use `public/get_time` method to obtain current server time.

signature_expiry_sec.title: signature_expiry_sec
signature_expiry_sec.description: Unix timestamp in seconds. Order signature becomes invalid after this time, and the system will cancel the order.Expiry MUST be at least 5 min from now.

signer.title: signer
signer.description: Owner wallet address or registered session key that signed order

time_in_force.title: time_in_force
time_in_force.description:
Time in force behaviour:
- `gtc`: good til cancelled (default)
- `post_only`: a limit order that will be rejected if it crosses any order in the book, i.e. acts as a taker order
- `fok`: fill or kill, will be rejected if it is not fully filled
- `ioc`: immediate or cancel, fill at best bid/ask (market) or at limit price (limit), the unfilled portion is cancelled
Note that the order will still expire on the `signature_expiry_sec` timestamp.

mmp_amount_limit.title: mmp_amount_limit
mmp_amount_limit.description:
Maximum total order amount that can be traded within the mmp_interval across all instruments of the provided currency. The amounts are not netted, so a filled bid of 1 and a filled ask of 2 would count as 3.
Default: 0 (no limit)

mmp_delta_limit.title: mmp_delta_limit
mmp_delta_limit.description:
Maximum total delta that can be traded within the mmp_interval across all instruments of the provided currency. This quantity is netted, so a filled order with +1 delta and a filled order with -2 delta would count as -1
Default: 0 (no limit)

mmp_frozen_time.title: mmp_frozen_time
mmp_frozen_time.description: Time interval in ms setting how long the subaccount is frozen after an mmp trigger, if 0 then a manual reset would be required via private/reset_mmp

mmp_interval.title: mmp_interval
mmp_interval.description: Time interval in ms over which the limits are monotored, if 0 then mmp is disabled

subaccount_id.title: subaccount_id
subaccount_id.description: Subaccount_id for which to set the config

limit_price.title: limit_price
limit_price.description:
Limit price in quote currency.
This field is still required for market orders because it is a component of the signature. However, market orders will not leave a resting order in the book in case of a partial fill.

max_fee.title: max_fee
max_fee.description: Max fee in units of the quote currency. Order will be rejected if the supplied max fee is below the estimated fee for this order.

mmp.title: mmp
mmp.description: Whether the order is tagged for market maker protections (default false)

nonce.title: nonce
nonce.description: Unique nonce defined as <UTC_timestamp in ms><random_number_up_to_6_digits> (e.g. 1695836058725001, where 001 is the random number)

order_type.title: order_type
order_type.description:
Order type:
- `limit`: limit order (default)
- `market`: market order, note that limit_price is still required for market orders, but unfilled order portion will be marked as cancelled

reduce_only.title: reduce_only
reduce_only.description: If true, the order will not be able to increase position's size (default false). If the order amount exceeds available position size, the order will be filled up to the position size and the remainder will be cancelled. This flag is only supported for market orders or non-resting limit orders (IOC or FOK)

referral_code.title: referral_code
referral_code.description: Optional referral code for the order

reject_timestamp.title: reject_timestamp
reject_timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in ms, if provided the matching engine will reject the order with an error if `reject_timestamp` < `server_time`. Note that the timestamp must be consistent with the server time: use `public/get_time` method to obtain current server time.

signature_expiry_sec.title: signature_expiry_sec
signature_expiry_sec.description: Unix timestamp in seconds. Order signature becomes invalid after this time, and the system will cancel the order.Expiry MUST be at least 5 min from now.

signer.title: signer
signer.description: Owner wallet address or registered session key that signed order

time_in_force.title: time_in_force
time_in_force.description:
Time in force behaviour:
- `gtc`: good til cancelled (default)
- `post_only`: a limit order that will be rejected if it crosses any order in the book, i.e. acts as a taker order
- `fok`: fill or kill, will be rejected if it is not fully filled
- `ioc`: immediate or cancel, fill at best bid/ask (market) or at limit price (limit), the unfilled portion is cancelled
Note that the order will still expire on the `signature_expiry_sec` timestamp.
